intro: Zeuxine shuishiehensis, commonly known as the Shuishieh zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in early summer. The plant has a herbaceous growth habit and features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
